title: 10:30 AM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Welfare Check
content:
Page 1 of 5
Officer responded to FM 2790 at FM 463 and Valero for a report of a stranded female
motorist. Officer checked areas of both locations given and was unable to locate.
12:53 PM Lt. Dear / Sgt. Hanson â€“ Juvenile Shot
Officer responded to CR 6853 to assist Medina Co. with a juvenile who had been shot.
2:34 PM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Returned Property
Officer released property back to rightful owner.
5:45 PM Lt. Dear â€“ Suspicious Activity
Officer responded to HEB Plus (19300 Blk. of McDonald St.) for a report of a family seen in the
store acting suspicious. When subjects were confronted by manager, they decided to leave the
products in cart and not to purchase them. Total value of items left behind $82.26.
5:58 PM Lt. Dear â€“ Theft
Officer responded to Lytle True Value (14900 Blk. of Main St.) for a report of an unknown male
that stole a pistol laser valued at $40.
6:50 PM Lt. Dear â€“ Criminal Mischief
Officer responded to Country View Apartments (19400 Blk. of McDonald St.) for a report of a
broken sliding glass door. Complainant was the property manager who observed the damage
and contacted the resident who gave complainant permission to enter the apartment. It was
noted that nothing looked disturbed.
11:17 PM Ofc. D. Lopez â€“ Suspicious Person(s)
Officer made contact with two male juveniles at the Lytle High School (18900 Blk. of FM 2790
N). Both juveniles stated they were walking home.
Page 2 of 5
Tuesday December 20
1:32 AM Ofc. D. Lopez â€“ Assist Agency
Officer responded to 200 Blk. of FM 3175 to assist an Atascosa Co. Deputy Sheriff with a
disturbance.
12:30 PM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Field Contact
Officer conducted a field contact on a male riding a bicycle at the Lytle Apartments.
6:30 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Vehicle Unlock
Officer assisted with unlocking a vehicle at Whataburger.
Wednesday December 21
10:20 AM Chief Priest / Capt. Reyes / Sgt. Hanson â€“ Fight in Progress
Officers responded to the HEB Plus for a reported fight in progress. Upon arrival all parties had
fled the scene.
3:00 PM Capt. Reyes / Sgt. Hanson / Chief Priest â€“ Funeral Escort
Officer provided a funeral escort to the Community Cemetery from FM 2790 N.
5:07 PM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Illegal Dumping
Officer responded to the Lytle Apartments for a report of trash dumped in the dumpster.
6:06 PM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Aggressive Dog
Officer contacted at the PD in reference to a dog that jumps a fence when the complainant
walks by in the 18400 Blk. of Wisdom Rd.
11:10 PM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Welfare Check
Officer responded to IH 35 at mile marker 131 for a report of a male walking in the lane of
traffic. Officer was unable to locate the subject.
11:49 PM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Accident
Officer investigated a 1 vehicle accident in the 19300 Blk. of N. Somerset St.
Page 3 of 5
Thursday December 22
7:57 AM Sgt. Hanson - Alarm
Officer responded to the El Bufalo Pawn (14600 Blk. FM 2790 E) for an alarm.
10:00 AM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Follow-Up
Officer conducted a follow-up in the 18400 Blk. of Wisdom Rd.
11:15 AM Sgt. Hanson / Ofc. D. Lopez â€“ Suspicious Activity
Officers responded to the John Lott Park for a report of 2 subjects exposing themselves.
12:30 PM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Dog Call
Officer was flagged down in the 18000 Blk. of Lake Wind by a walker and advised about a loose
dog that the walker pepper sprayed.
6:40 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ 911 Hang-Up Officer responded to 14900 Blk. of Adams St. for a 911 hang-up.
8:30 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Vehicle Unlock
Officer responded to the Coal Mine Church for a vehicle unlock.
9:10 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Reckless Driver
Officer responded to IH 35 at mile maker 131 for a reckless driver.
10:05 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Alarm Call
Officer responded to the Exxon for an alarm.
Friday December 23
4:22 AM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Assist Agency
Officer responded to IH 35 at FM 3175 to assist ACSO with a traffic stop.
Page 4 of 5
1:42 PM Chief Priest / Lt. Dear â€“ Suspicious Circumstances
Officers responded to the HEB Plus for a report of suspicious circumstances.
9:30 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Damaged Property
Officer responded to the 19100 Blk. of N. Somerset St. for a report of a damaged pole.
11:45 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Abandoned Vehicle
Officer red tagged an abandoned vehicle on the Access Rd. of IH 35.
Saturday December 24
12:20 AM Capt. Reyes - Vehicle Unlock Officer responded to the Pumphouse Carwash to unlock a vehicle.
12:25 AM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Alarm
Officer responded to the El Bufalo Pawn (14600 Blk. FM 2790 E) for an alarm.
2:09 AM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Suspicious Activity
Officer observed a vehicle parked at the US Renal Care construction site (19900 Blk. IH 35). It
was determined that workers were there late.
8:10 AM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Theft
Officer responded to the McDonaldâ€™s for a stolen wallet. Total value of theft $150.
12:40 PM Ofc. D. Lopez â€“ Burglary of a Vehicle
Officer responded to the Hacienda Jaliciense (20000 Blk. IH 35) for a burglary of a motor
vehicle. Unknown suspect(s) stole several hand tools with an unknown value.
5:00 PM Lt. Dear â€“ Possession of Marijuana
Officer responded to the HEB C-Store (19500 Blk. McDonald St.) for a report of suspicious
activity. Investigation resulted in the arrest of Xzavier Benavides (19) for Possession of
Marijuana <2 ounces.
Page 5 of 5
8:26 PM Lt. Dear â€“ Criminal Mischief
Officer responded to the 18300 Blk. of Wisdom Rd. for a report of a broken window to a
residence.
8:50 PM Sgt. Hanson / Lt. Dear â€“ Criminal Mischief
Officersâ€™ responded to the 14900 Blk. of Lytle-Somerset St. for a report of damaged done to a
rental vehicle.
Sunday December 25
12:28 AM Ofc. Petrash â€“ Open Car Door
Officer located an open car door in the 18800 Blk. of N. Prairie St.
3:15 AM Sgt. Hanson â€“ Illegal Fireworks
While on patrol officer located residents setting off fireworks in the 17900 Blk. of Eathans
Crossing. Officer counseled about the use of fireworks within the city limits.
10:15 AM Capt. Reyes / Chief Priest â€“ Be On the Lookout
Officers received information in reference to a stolen ATV on CR 683.
10:40 AM Capt. Reyes â€“ Recovered Stolen ATV
Officer recovered the stolen ATV from previous incident in the 18800 Blk. of Wisdom Rd. The
ATV crashed thru a fence at a residence and the suspects fled.
12:45 PM Capt. Reyes â€“ Assist Agency
Officer assisted Medina Co. S.O. with detaining a suspect on CR 6844 @ CR 6842 in reference
to the previous ATV theft.
